metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3732 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's OverlayFS subsystem in the way theuser mounts the TmpFS filesystem with OverlayFS. This flaw allows a localuser to gain access to hidden files that should not be accessible.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-159-generic - 4.15.0-159.167
linux-image-4.15.0-159-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-159.167
linux-image-4.15.0-159-lowlatency - 4.15.0-159.167
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-159-generic - 4.15.0-159.167
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-159-lowlatency - 4.15.0-159.167
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-89-generic - 5.4.0-89.100~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-159.167').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-89.100~18.04.1').
